bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington

div1.p: In the Superior Court of the State of Washington -for the- COUNTY OF KING
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF Yvonne Le Fevre, Manie LeFevre, and Georgette Normand FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS}
THE STATE OF WASHINGTON TO Sister M. Angelique, Sister Superior of the House of the Good Shepard

Greeting: We command you, that you have the body ies of Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre, and Georgette Normand by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name, said Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre, and Georgette Normand shall be named or charged, before Hon. N.R. Bell Judge of the Superior Court of the State of Washington for the County of King, at the court room of said Court in the Conunty of King, on the 14th day of Febuary 1903, at 9:30 o'clock in the fore noon of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre, and Georgette Normand.
And have you then and there this writ

WITNESS, Hon. N.R. Bell Judge of the Superior Court of the State of Washington, for the County of King, at the court room thereof, in said county, this 13 day of July A.D. 1903 ATTEST my hand and seal of said Superior Court the day and year last above written
In US Circuit Court Northern Division District of Washington
In the Application of Jas. P. Lavin & Sister Superior M. Angelique, for a Writ of Cretorari
Supplemental Return & Petition for rehearing and modification of order & judgement
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON MAR 5 1903 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Walthew Dep.
